name: Todd Waterbury
biography:
Attended Iowa State University as the first recipient of the Helen Beresford scholarship.
During third year of college, worked as intern at the Duffy Group, Fallon McElligott, Minneapolis.
Advanced toSenior Art Director, Duffy Group; clients included Giorgio Armani, Rolling Stone, Porsche and Jim Bean Brands.
Executive Art Director, Bloomingdale's Advertising; directed team in retail, packaging and identity work for the company's buyers in all its stores.
Joined Wieden & Kennedy, Portland, Oregon c.1994. International creative director for software (Microsoft) and soft drinks (Diet Coke, Powerade, Barq's). Clients also have included Nike and The State of Oregon Tourism Commission. 
Awards: Best of Category medals, D&AD and Art Directors Club.
Work included in the publications Eye, Archive, The New York Times Op-Ed page and in the permament collections of the Victoria & Albert Museum (London), the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and the Museum of Modern Art (New York).
